SIPHOSETHU GAJANA

I am a junior full stack web developer with 5 months experience from projects I have built as part of my course content. I see it important to develop into an outstanding person in my work, and in leadership skills, as well as to contribute to the enhancement of the community at large. I am a team player, take criticism as an opportunity to learn from my weaknesses and grow.

Education

Work

Company: Mpumakoloni Youth Initiative

Position: Administrator

Duration: 03/2019 - current

    Duties:
  • Provide administrative support.
  • Capturing clients information and maintaining effective and efficient filling.
  • Build and maintain relationships with different stakeholders.
  • Organise Youth events as per calender.
  • Organise and facilitate awareness campaigns and youth dialogues for schools in Tsomo and Youth in communities.
  • Strengthen active referrals between schools, DSD, DOE, SAPS,Department of Health, Department of Home affairs and traditional leaders.
  • Engage with youth in communities and schools to identify their challenges and facilitate referrals.

Mfesane NPC

position: Social work intern

Duration: 01/2017- 12/2017

    Duties:
  • Conducted group work sessions on life skills to address identified needs of the children and youth in the programme.
  • Assisted child and youth care workers to ensure as far as reasonably possible that children at the centre are not physically or emotionally harmed.
  • Ensured all health and safety practices are adhered to.
  • Ensured that children are supervised at all times including ablution times and outside playground activities.
  • Monitored child and youth care workers’ performance in terms of set standards.
  • Provided supervision and guidance to child and youth care workers on an on-going basis, regarding issues related to the work programmes.
  • Identified training needs of child and youth care workers and assist with any training initiatives.
  • Ensured that the centre is filled to its maximum capacity at all times. This includes the recruiting and screening of potential children.
  • Provided social work services (to children attending the project and their families) –in the event of any social problems.
  • Undertook this range of duties and responsibilities specified in the Childrens Act 38 of 2005.
  • Rendered family preservation to families where neglect and abuse is reported. Investigated and further referred alleged neglect, ill treatment or abuse of children.
  • Completed form 22 to notify DSD of these allegations. Assisted with all awareness events in line with the national themes with specific emphasis on child protection, children’s rights.
  • Assisted with all other events i.e. talks, homeworks, recreational activities, school holiday programmes.
  • Assisted with any other reasonable tasks from time to time as delegated by the Programme Manager i.e. monitoring and mentoring of 9 NGO’s over four months, providing HIV/AIDS pre counselling at HTS events, assist PM with completing of monthly reports and stats.
